docs.text: it's a sad state of affairs when the back box blurb is more exciting than the movie contained within it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: such is the case for the 1990 paul mayersberg film _the last samurai_ .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: though the blurb alludes to " a jungle filled with political intrigue , uneasy alliances , and murderous enemies at every turn , " the story of the movie is actually quite simple ( and prosaic ) : a middle-aged japanese businessman named endo ( played by john fujioka ) and his assistant , both of whom have samurai aspirations , travel to africa in search of his ancestor , who went to bring buddhism to africa .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he hires the services of down-at-the-heels vietnam veteran pilot johnny congo ( the redoubtable lance henriksen ) and his girlfriend ( arabella holzbog ) , and travels to the camp of an arms-merchant-cum-safari-host- cum-islamic-missionary ( john saxon ) and his wife ( lisa eilbacher ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they are all kidnapped by an african revolutionary guerilla with witch-doctor aspirations to conceal a pre-arranged arms deal , which subsequently falls through .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: congo escapes , finds endo's ancestor's sword , and comes back , guns blazing , to free the rest of them , and endo kills the revolutionary with the sword .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: _the last samurai_ is one of those movies that is neither bad enough nor good enough to be enjoyable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the murky plot is filled with subtexts that are never elaborated , subplots that are never explained , and many scenes that make very little sense at all .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film is shot through with all the tired old " inscrutable japanese samurai " and zen stereotypes that are to be expected from an american movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is quite slow-paced , with only a bit of action near the end , and the final duel between endo and the terrorist is quite anticlimactic .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of the acting is fair , with the possible exception of congo's girlfriend .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: lance henriksen is his usual scene-chewing self , and is one of few possible reasons anyone might conceivably have for seeing this movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the only other bright spot is the sweeping african scenery .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i paid $3 for this film , from the discount rack at best buy , and halfway suspect i overpaid for it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if you are in the mood for samurai , read a clavell novel or watch a kurusawa movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: skip _the last samurai_ unless you are a die-hard henriksen fan .
docs.label: negative
